question.body: Two vessels, A and B, have the same diameter, but vessel B is 3 times the length of vessel A. How would the resistance between the two vessels compare?

multiple_choice.choice: The resistance of vessel B would be 3 times that of vessel A.
The resistance of vessel B would be 1/3 that of vessel A.
There is no difference because their diameters are the same.

response.feedback: Correct. The resistance of a vessel is directly proportional to its length.
Incorrect. Making a vessel longer does not decrease its resistance.
Incorrect. Even though diameter (radius) is the most important factor in determining resistance, vessel length and the viscosity of the fluid also play a role.

part.hint: In the equation for the resistance of a single vessel, determine the relationship, if any, of vessel length to resistance.
